title: The Stories of Shurima
body:
I have dedicated my morning to re-read all the lore linked with **the territory of Shurima** to locate as many stories as possible and to put them on a map.

This is the result, I hope you like it: 

https://imgur.com/a/qTJFAmX

On the other hand I found mentions to other places that I think are in Shurima but do not appear on the map, here a list in case it helps.

[[Twilight of the Gods story](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/twilight-of-the-gods/)]

* River Khaleek 
* ~~Kha’zhun trade post~~
* Parnesa

[[Malzahar bio](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/malzahar/)]

* Amakra 

[[Kai'sa comic](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/kaisa-comic)]

* Tejaru
* Blighted pass

[[Rammus bio](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/rammus/)]

* Fortress of Siram
* Lake of Imalli

PD: If @Bioluminiscence goes through here: Could you say how long it took for Taliyah to cross from Bel'zhun to Vekaura? Thanks and sorry for having more and more questions all the time.

Honestly, because of Yasuo's training and her passive with her being in her "natural habitat" I'd assume her travel speed would be in line with a cavalry since stone surfing should be roughly at the same speed as a horse.

Actually, she probably clears a force march speed because I would say she's gallopping as opposed to trotting.  The real question to assess s whether or not she has the full capacity to continuously surf like that.

Speed isn't even the prevalent question.  It's how consistent can she go.

We also have two (!!) video examples showing Taliyah travelling.  Other champs should be so lucky!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H1nRIX-qvbo

https://youtu.be/3Eu7NzzHC84

But I agree with you that it's unclear from even these examples what kind of pace she can keep over extended periods of time.  I have an estimate myself (as well as Dormun rider pace - and other forms of travel that would not be as well suited to the desert and would suffer penalties) but it's not been extensively vetted.
Why should stone surfing be the same speed as a horse?

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=vfPutJLE,comment-id=000400000001,timestamp=2018-07-26T15:24:36.869+0000)
>
> Why should stone surfing be the same speed as a horse?

Cavalry was mentioned since Bio answered the question of "how long will it take to travel from Noxus to Demacia."  Calculations were done using real life examples of Romans, Medieval armies, and the like looking at average speeds. Cavalry obviously moves faster than troops on foot.  I only used Cavalry because they move faster.  If anything, Stone surfing looks like it could potentially be a horse galloping at full speed (if even that slow).

Horse was a minimal estimate to work around. My main question is how long can she surf continuously.  Even if surfing is faster than a horse, if she can only travel for half as long as the cavalry can, then speed is mute.
What about Taliyah’s route through the Freljord, though?

We almost know nothing about her stay at Freljord for now. 

With who did she stay? 
Who was her teacher? 
Where did she travelled exactly? 

Lot of questions without answers for now.
How about the most important question: where did she get that adorable baby deer?
Not sure if that's canon at all but if it is we'll probably have to wait for the full story of her Freljordian travels for the answer.
I want it to be a heartwarming and wholesome tale about friendship in the Freljordian wilderness.
Riot is recruiting a lot of Warhammer 40k writers. They are not exactly known for write about true friendship and lovely sceneries (?)
carnage is just as good
I think the character (read: quotes) point to canon, but I doubt she dyed her hair or started controlling ice. :P

Aah hello Icathia. I did a lore video for Malzahar and I know that he crossed a severe distance to it, but I mean damn, that does look quite vast. Interesting map notes!


P.S. here is his video if you're interested https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zSdim9xzMCI
**Thanks!** I will take a look at that video.
